noun.description: In vertebrate embryos: a cavity in the centre of an early myotome. Also: a compartment of the coelom associated with each myotome in adult amphioxus (Branchiostoma) and other cephalochordates.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Quarterly Journal of Microscopical Science. From myo- + -coele, after German Myocöl.
